sentence: Home improvement warehouse operators The Home Depot, Inc. ( HD ) and Lowe's Companies, Inc. ( LOW ) on Wednesday both saw their price targets raised by analysts at Barclays Capital.
The firm said it raised its target for HD from $37 to $38, which implies a 10% upside to the stock's Tuesday closing price of $34.67.
Barclays kept its "Overweight" rating on Home Depot unchanged.
Meanwhile, the analyst lifted its price target for LOW from $26 to $28, suggesting a 14% upside to the stock's Tuesday closing price of $24.56.
It also maintained its "Overweight" rating on LOW.
Barclays said it believes the home improvement market has bottomed, and should continue on a steady path of recovery, hence the rosier outlook for the two biggest players in the sector.
Both Home Depot and Lowe's shares were mostly flat in premarket trading Wednesday.
Shares of Home Depot ( HD ) have a 2.71% dividend yield, based on last night's closing stock price of $34.67.
Shares of Lowe's ( LOW ) have a 1.79% dividend yield, based on last night's closing stock price of $24.56.
The Home Depot, Inc. ( HD ) and Lowe's Companies, Inc. ( LOW ) are both rated "Neutral," holding Dividend.com DARSâ„¢ Ratings of 3.4 out of 5 stars.
